text.p: These are the headlines selected from Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Search begins for Bre-X culprits: CEO pledges to get to bottom of tampering scandal that wiped out some investors' savings.
- Britain launches new era in Europe: Labour pledges end to hostility.
- Sandbaggers rally to Winnipeg's aid: Volunteers rush to danger points, sling bags and banter to beat the river.
- Liberals feel heat along Acadian shore: New battle lines being drawn in region.
- South Africa's foreign policy reflects new continental status.
- Busang samples salted at depot: Freeport knew in March but kept silent to allow completion of independent report.
- Bre-X probes focus on tampering, fraud: Police, regulators - and investors - begin their quest for the truth as Strathcona audit confirms Busang gold play is a colossal scam.
